articles.title: Choe Ryong Hae Meets Interim President of Brazil
articles.content:
Choe Ryong Hae Meets Interim President of Brazil
Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Choe Ryong Hae, vice-chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK, taking parting in the 31st Olympic Games as head of a DPRK high-level delegation met and had a talk with Temer, interim president of the Federativ e Republic of Brazil, on August 5.
					 Choe Ryong Hae said the Korean people are waging a dynamic struggle to implement the decision of the Seventh Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea under the guidance of the Party, expressing the stand of the DPRK government to develop the friendly and cooperative relations with Brazil.
					
					 The interim president said that the Brazilian government will boost the friendly and cooperative relations with the DPRK.
					
					 Meanwhile, Choe Ryong Hae separately met with heads of state of Switzerland and San Marino and vice-presidents of Angola, Equatorial Guinea and Zambia.

articles.title: Choe Ryong Hae Meets Officials Concerned of 31st Olympic Games
articles.content:
Choe Ryong Hae Meets Officials Concerned of 31st Olympic Games
Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Choe Ryong Hae, vice-chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK, participating in the 31st Olympic Games as head of a DPRK high-level delegation, separately met with the president of the International Olympic Committee (IOC), the chairman of the organizing committee of the Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games and the president of the International Judo Federation (IJF) on Aug. 4.
					 The president of the IOC expressed deep thanks to the DPRK leadership over dispatching its high-level delegation led by a vice-chairman of the State Affairs Commission to the 31st Olympic Games.
					
					 Saying that the DPRK government is directing its efforts to developing sports with the goal for building a sports powerhouse, he stressed that the IOC hopes for boosting the cooperative and close relations with the DPRK.
					
					 The chairman of the organizing committee of the Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games said he came to know that the DPRK government is attaching very weighty significance to the current Olympic Games, hoping that sportspersons of the DPRK would register good achievements in the games.
					
					 The president of the IJF said that a DPRK's high-level delegation's participation in the current Olympic Games reflected the DPRK government's will to develop the country's sports and boost the exchange and cooperation with world sportspersons.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Cote d'Ivoire
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Cote d'Ivoire
Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greeting to Alassane Ouattara, president of the Republic of Cote d'Ivoire, on Sunday on the 56th anniversary of its independence.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, wishing the president and people of Cote d'Ivoire bigger achievements in their work for the development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Gift from Japanese Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Gift from Japanese Delegation
Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un was presented with a gift by a delegation of the Japan Nagano Prefectural People's Council for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea on a visit to the DPRK.
					 The gift was conveyed to an official concerned by head of the delegation Tomohiko Murayama, chairman of the council, on Sunday.

articles.title: Foreign Guests Pay Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreign Guests Pay Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Japan Nagano Prefectural People's Council for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea and other foreign guests visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Sunday.
					 They paid tribute to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il before their statues.
					
					 They made bows to the great leaders who lie in state.
					
					 They went round the halls where the orders the great leaders received are on display and halls that house cars, electric car, boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their lives.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Inspects Namhung Youth Chemical Complex
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Inspects Namhung Youth Chemical Complex
Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju made a field survey of the Namhung Youth Chemical Complex.
					 Going round various places of the complex, he learned in detail about fertilizer production for the manuring year before holding a consultative meeting.
					
					 The meeting stressed the need to make a turn in the development of chemical industry as required by the building of a powerful socialist country, and the importance of the duty being performed by the complex in building C? chemical industry.
					
					 It also discussed the issues of increasing fertilizer output by giving priority to equipment overhauling, increasing the proportion of locally available law and other materials and putting the production on a higher Juche and modern basis.
					
					 Meanwhile, the premier went round the steel workshop and seamless steel pipe workshop of the Chollima Steel Complex and revolving furnaces of the Posan Iron Works, where he organized the work for putting the metal industry on a stronger independent and Juche basis and increasing the iron and steel production.

articles.title: 70th Anniversary of National Symphony Orchestra Marked
articles.content:
70th Anniversary of National Symphony Orchestra Marked
Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- The National Symphony Orchestra marked its 70th founding anniversary in the DPRK.
					 The orchestra was founded by President Kim Il Sung as the first art organization of liberated Korea on August 8, Juche 35 (1946). It has developed into a prestigious art organization created by leader Kim Jong Il as the world level symphony orchestra and an art group representing the DPRK by playing an important role in developing Juche-based orchestra and music art.
					
					 Over the past seven decades since it declared its founding with its premiere of immortal revolutionary hymn "Song of General Kim Il Sung", the orchestra has powerfully promoted the advance of the DPRK, remaining loyal to the guidance of the party and the great leaders through revolutionary creative activities and the production of famous works representing the times.
					
					 It has aroused the masses' revolutionary enthusiasm and patriotic devotion by creating and performing symphonies and orchestral music of diverse themes with rich ideological contents and high artistry in each annul of the revolution and created and represented monumental works such as serial symphonies "Song to the Party" and thus contributed to conveying to posterity the revolutionary history of the great leaders and the history of struggle of the DPRK.
					
					 There took place a meeting marking the 70th anniversary of the National Symphony Orchestra at the National Theatre on Sunday.
					
					 Present there were Kim Ki Nam, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), Pak Chun Nam, minister of Culture, officials concerned and creators, artistes and employees of the National Symphony Orchestra and central art organizations.
					
					 A congratulatory message of the Central Committee of the WPK was conveyed to the creators and artistes of the National Symphony Orchestra at the meeting.

articles.title: Korean Social Scientists in Japan Flail THAAD Deployment in South Korea
articles.content:
Korean Social Scientists in Japan Flail THAAD Deployment in South Korea
Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Ri Yong Su, chairman of the Korean Social Scientists Association in Japan, released a statement on Aug. 4 lambasting the Park Geun Hye group's moves to deploy THAAD in south Korea.
					 The deployment of THAAD in south Korea is a treacherous act that leaves the destiny of the nation to the tender mercy of the U.S., which seeks to secure military edge in Asia-Pacific, prompted by the vicious intention to bring down the DPRK and carry out the wild dream of "unification through absorption", the statement said, and continued:
					
					 The Korean Social Scientists Association in Japan condemns the Park Geun Hye regime for turning south Korea into the biggest theatre of a nuclear war and selling the dignity and interests of the country and nation to the outsiders, labeling this pro-U.S. act as the indelible act of treachery.
					
					 The THAAD deployment is a last-ditch effort of the U.S. to retain its supremacy at any cost in a bid to dominate the world.
					
					 Traitor Park Geun Hye is making desperate efforts to get rid of the ruling crisis and realize the daydream to stifle the fellow countrymen in the north by selling off the national interests to the U.S. master but she can hardly escape its final ruin as is the case with the U.S.
					
					 Stern punishment by history awaits the U.S. and Park Geun Hye.

articles.title: Chongryon Official Flays U.S., S. Korean Puppet Forces for Deciding to Deploy THAAD
articles.content:
Chongryon Official Flays U.S., S. Korean Puppet Forces for Deciding to Deploy THAAD
Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), made public a statement on August 2 to flail the U.S. and the south Korean puppet group of traitors for deciding to deploy THAAD in south Korea.
					 The statement bitterly denounced the U.S. and the Park Geun Hye group for turning the whole of south Korea into the U.S. outpost for a nuclear war and working hard to inflict a nuclear disaster upon the entire nation by deploying THAAD.
					
					 If the Park Geun Hye regime, rare sycophants and war servants, is allowed to go scot-free, there will be neither peace and reunification of the country nor the security of the nation, the statement noted.
					
					 The Park group will be sternly judged by the nation as it is resorting to pro-U.S. act of treachery, going against the aspiration of the fellow countrymen and the demand of the times, it said.

articles.title: Nature Museum, Central Zoo in Pyongyang Crowded with Visitors
articles.content:
Nature Museum, Central Zoo in Pyongyang Crowded with Visitors
Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- An endless stream of visitors is now flowing to the Nature Museum and the Central Zoo in Pyongyang, the capital city of the DPRK, which were built into a peculiar education and leisure complex.
					 Nearly 200,000 working people, school youth and children, overseas compatriots and foreigners have visited the museum and zoo after their inauguration on July 25.
					
					 The museum, built on the principle of scientific accuracy, practicality and kind service, leads its visitors to ecstasy.
					
					 Scores of animal sheds, including the reptile shed and monkey shed, were constructed on the basis of such visual effect and good formative art that any visitor can easily know what animal sheds they are even from a distance and may feel as if he or she had come to the habitats of animals.
					
					 At the zoo there is a place where animals display their skills of playing sports games and music before visitors.
					
					 It is also equipped or arranged with battery cars and flower-decorated coaches and public catering establishments to offer conveniences to the visitors.

articles.title: Park Geun Hye of S. Korea Branded as Modern-day "Traitor of 1905"
articles.content:
Park Geun Hye of S. Korea Branded as Modern-day "Traitor of 1905"
Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) - Ryang Ok Chul, chairwoman of the Central Standing Committee of the Korean Democratic Women's Union in Japan, released a statement on August 4 in denunciation of the U.S. and the south Korean regime's anachronistic moves to deploy THAAD.
					 The statement termed the U.S. imperialists the sworn enemy of the Korean nation as they are working hard to bring THAAD to south Korea in a bid to build a missile shield for invading the DPRK and dominating Asia-Pacific.
					
					 Terming Park Geun Hye modern-day "traitor of 1905," the statement declared that the Koreans would never pardon the Park Geun Hye group for talking about "security of the people", utterly indifferent to the lives and security of the children in Songju County and other parts of south Korea.
					
					 All officials of the women's union and Korean women in Japan will turn out as one in the sacred struggle for resolutely denouncing the THAAD deployment and supporting the righteous struggle of south Koreans.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Raps S. Korean Regime's Ridiculous Diplomacy for Soliciting Foreign Cooperation
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Raps S. Korean Regime's Ridiculous Diplomacy for Soliciting Foreign Cooperation
Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Jo Thae Yong, first vice-chief of the security office of Chongwadae in south Korea, recently  made U.S. junket under the pretext of attending the third south Korea-U.S. high- level strategic meeting. He clung tightly to the coattail of the American master, imploring for the "international community's sustainable and efficient sanctions against the north."
					 Meanwhile, brass hats of the south Korean puppet military traveled several countries to solicit cooperation in putting military pressure upon the north over its "nuclear threat and provocation."
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday in a commentary ridicules this as a desperate effort of the fools who repeat their vices, unaware of where they stand at present. 
					
					 The Park Geun Hye group is conducting such zealous solicitation diplomacy, clutching the sleeves of foreign forces in a bid to stifle the compatriots in the north, still unaware of the miserable doom fast approaching, but this will get it nowhere.
					
					 The south Korean puppet forces will never be pardoned for trying hard to force the DPRK to dismantle the self-defensive nuclear deterrence, dignity and pride of the Korean nation, with the backing of the outside forces, and realize the ambition for invading it but they will have to pay dearly for this crime.
					
					 Though they ran wild to stifle the DPRK as lackeys for implementing the U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK, they have not blocked the DPRK dynamically advancing by dint of single-minded unity under the banner of Songun.
					
					 They had better stop such folly as wasting time with ridiculous charades and defaming themselves and wait for the stern punishment by history. This is our advice.

articles.title: Minju Joson Slams Park Geun Hye's Invectives against DPRK
articles.content:
Minju Joson Slams Park Geun Hye's Invectives against DPRK
Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- At a "state council meeting" on Aug. 2 Park Geun Hye of south Korea again betrayed her bad habit of accusing the DPRK.
					 That day she spouted a flurry of jargons that she is concerned about the unending dispute over THAAD deployment despite the potential nuclear and missile threat from the DPRK and that the political camp should pool efforts to prevent inner division and conflict wanted by the north. Her harangue also included the claim that her regime is "persuading" and "closely cooperating" with all countries in the efforts to pressurize the north to "dismantle its nukes and missiles."
					
					 Commenting on this, Minju Joson Sunday says:
					
					 What Park uttered reflects her sinister intention to escalate the confrontation with the compatriots in the north.
					
					 Her regime is chiefly to blame for causing the THAAD crisis in south Korea.
					
					 The deployment of THAAD in south Korea only serves the purpose of the U.S. strategy for dominating Asia-Pacific to all intents and purposes. It is, therefore, the root cause of a new Cold War as it seriously strains the situation on the Korean peninsula and in the region and will spark a new arms race.
					
					 This being a hard fact, Park is impudently getting increasingly vocal faulting the DPRK. 
					
					 This is no more than a last-ditch attempt to get rid of her pretty fix by diverting to the DPRK the censure and condemnation of her regime's reckless THAAD deployment by the public in south Korea and other parts of the world and justifying her thrice-cursed crimes.
					
					 The nuclear deterrent of the DPRK for self-defence represents the dignity and pride of the nation.
					
					 No matter how desperately the puppet regime trumpets about the "nuclear and missile threat from the north" in a bid to stifle the DPRK, it can never get rid of its plight as colonial lackeys on the verge of ruin.

articles.title: No-THAAD Candlelight Actions Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
No-THAAD Candlelight Actions Staged in S. Korea
Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Residents of Songju County, North Kyongsang Province of south Korea held a candlelight rally before the building of the county office on Aug. 4 in demand of a halt to THAAD deployment, according to south Korean online paper Voice of People. 
					 Speakers at the rally recalled there is news that the regime is to reexamine the site for THAAD.
					
					 As regards the news, the Songju Committee for Checking Deployment of THAAD clarified its stand that THAAD should never be deployed in any part of south Korea and only then, peace can be preserved, they held.
					
					 While the rally was under way, the attendants sang songs deriding and censuring Park Geun Hye.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Regime Accused of Obstructing Holding of Joint Conference
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Regime Accused of Obstructing Holding of Joint Conference
Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- Son Hyong Gun, chairman of the Federation of South Koreans in Japan for Democracy and Reunification who doubles as vice-chairman of the Overseas Side Preparatory Committee for the Joint Conference of Political Parties, Organizations and Individual Personages of the North, the South and Abroad, issued a statement on August 5 to denounce the south Korean puppet regime for obstructing the holding of the joint conference.
					 The Park regime is not only turning down the proposal of the north while terming it "typical offensive for unification" and "offensive for dialogue" but obstructing the actions of people from all walks of life supporting the joint conference, the statement charged.
					
					 The proposal reflected the urgency and validity acceptable to any member of the nation, it said, urging the Park regime stop at once the obstructions.

articles.title: Preparatory Committee for 2017 Meeting Praising Great Persons of Mt. Paektu Formed in Costa Rica
articles.content:
Preparatory Committee for 2017 Meeting Praising Great Persons of Mt. Paektu Formed in Costa Rica
Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee of Costa Rica for the 2017 Meeting Praising Great Persons of Mt. Paektu was recently formed.
					 Jose Francisco Aguilar Bulgarelli, honorary chairman of the Latin American Institute of the Juche Idea, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The preparatory committee decided to organize various political and cultural events praising the exploits of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Remembered in Ulan Bator
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Remembered in Ulan Bator
Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- A remembrance meeting took place in Ulan Bator on Aug. 1 on the 60th anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's visit to Mongolia.
					 Displayed at the venue were works of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un, books introducing the DPRK and immortal flower Kimjongilias in full bloom.
					
					 Present at the meeting were figures of the Mongolian Kimjongilia Association, J. Sambuu Herders Development Fund of Mongolia, the Mongolian Mt. Paektu Association for Independent Development and the Mongolian Centre for the Study of Juche and masses.
					
					 Recollecting the deep loving care the President showed for the family of the chairman of the Mongolian Kimjongilia Association, he renewed his will to widely cultivate Kimjongilias, eternal symbol of friendship between Mongolia and DPRK, hold Kimjongilia exhibitions with greater splendor and introduce the undying exploits of the President among Mongolians.
					
					 The president of the J. Sambuu Herders Development Fund of Mongolia said the Mongolian people praise Kim Il Sung as an ordinary and modest man who brought only well-being to people.
					
					 He praised Kim Il Sung for performing great exploits for the development of friendship between Mongolia and the DPRK. 
					
					 He said he would work hard for the development of the bilateral friendly relations.

articles.title: DPRK's War Victory Day Observed by Chinese, British Media
articles.content:
DPRK's War Victory Day Observed by Chinese, British Media
Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- A Chinese magazine and British newspaper dedicated special write-ups to the 63rd anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The July issue of the Chinese Hong Kong magazine International Link carried articles illustrated with photos of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Recalling that the U.S. signed the Armistice Agreement on July 27, 1953, the magazine said that Clark, the then "UN Forces" commander, admitted the U.S. defeat, deploring his inglorious position as he was the "first commander of the U.S. forces in history who signed the AA after sustaining a defeat".
					
					 It cited numbers to explain what great losses and shameful heavy setbacks the U.S. imperialists suffered with several defeated generals fired one after another though they boasted of "victory" in the early days of the war. 
					
					 Elaborating on the root cause and injustice of the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK, the magazine stressed that if the nuclear issue on the Korean peninsula is to be settled, it is necessary for the U.S. to roll back its hostile policy toward the DPRK, to begin with.
					
					 The July issue of the British newspaper Line of March carried an article illustrated with a photo of Kim Il Sung to disclose the U.S. true colors as the provocateur of the Korean war and its thrice-cursed atrocities and denounce the U.S. for conducting madcap nuclear war drills while persistently denying the conclusion of a peace treaty with the DPRK.

articles.title: German Body Censures U.S. Hostile Policy towards DPRK
articles.content:
German Body Censures U.S. Hostile Policy towards DPRK
Pyongyang, August 7 (KCNA) -- The Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany released a statement on August 1 in protest against the U.S. persistent hostile policy towards the DPRK.
					 The statement said:
					
					 Politicians of the U.S. are utterly unaware of what is coming out from their mouths.
					
					 The U.S. secretary of State's remarks at the ministerial meeting of the ASEAN Regional Forum that the U.S. has no hostile intent on the DPRK are a sheer lie.
					
					 The U.S. is advocating the denuclearization of the Korean peninsula and other parts of the world while modernizing its nuclear arsenal behind the scene with the investment of funds running to astronomical figures. 
					
					 The world is exposed to a serious danger owing to the U.S.
					
					 It is only the DPRK that bitterly rebuffs and condemns the U.S. moves and deters it from behaving as it pleases.
